org.gearvrf

Class GVRAssetLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRAssetLoader

  • public final class GVRAssetLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    GVRAssetLoader provides methods for importing 3D models and making them available through instances of GVRAssimpImporter.

    Supports importing models from an application's resources (both assets and res/raw), from directories on the device's SD card and URLs on the internet that the application has permission to read.

    • Method Detail

      • loadTexture

        public GVRTexture loadTexture(GVRAndroidResource resource,
                              GVRTextureParameters textureParameters)
        Loads file placed in the assets folder, as a GVRBitmapTexture with the user provided texture parameters.

        Note that this method may take hundreds of milliseconds to return: unless the texture is quite tiny, you probably don't want to call this directly from your onStep() callback as that is called once per frame, and a long call will cause you to miss frames. For large images, you should use loadTexture(GVRAndroidResource, GVRAndroidResource.TextureCallback).

        This method automatically scales large images to fit the GPU's restrictions and to avoid out of memory errors.

        Parameters:
        resource - Basically, a stream containing a bitmap texture. The GVRAndroidResource class has six constructors to handle a wide variety of Android resource types. Taking a GVRAndroidResource here eliminates six overloads.
        textureParameters - The texture parameter object which has all the values that were provided by the user for texture enhancement. The GVRTextureParameters class has methods to set all the texture filters and wrap states. If this parameter is nullo, default texture parameters are used.
        Returns:
        The file as a texture, or null if the file can not be decoded into a Bitmap.
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_TEXTURE_PARAMETERS

      • loadTexture

        public GVRTexture loadTexture(GVRAndroidResource resource)

      • loadTexture

        public void loadTexture(GVRAndroidResource resource,
                        GVRAndroidResource.TextureCallback callback,
                        GVRTextureParameters texparams,
                        int priority,
                        int quality)
        Loads a texture asynchronously. This method can detect whether the resource file holds a compressed texture (GVRF currently supports ASTC, ETC2, and KTX formats: applications can add new formats by implementing GVRCompressedTextureLoader): if the file is not a compressed texture, it is loaded as a normal, bitmapped texture. This format detection adds very little to the cost of loading even a compressed texture, and it makes your life a lot easier: you can replace, say, res/raw/resource.png with res/raw/resource.etc2 without having to change any code.
        Parameters:
        callback - Before loading, GVRF may call stillWanted() several times (on a background thread) to give you a chance to abort a 'stale' load. Successful loads will call loaded() on the GL thread; any errors will call failed(), with no promises about threading.

        This method uses a throttler to avoid overloading the system. If the throttler has threads available, it will run this request immediately. Otherwise, it will enqueue the request, and call stillWanted() at least once (on a background thread) to give you a chance to abort a 'stale' load.

        Use loadFutureTexture(GVRAndroidResource) to avoid having to implement a callback.

        resource - Basically, a stream containing a texture file. The GVRAndroidResource class has six constructors to handle a wide variety of Android resource types. Taking a GVRAndroidResource here eliminates six overloads.
        texparams - GVRTextureParameters object containing texture sampler attributes.
        priority - This request's priority. Please see the notes on asynchronous priorities in the package description. Also, please note priorities only apply to uncompressed textures (standard Android bitmap files, which can take hundreds of milliseconds to load): compressed textures load so quickly that they are not run through the request scheduler.
        quality - The compressed texture quality parameter: should be one of GVRCompressedTexture.SPEED, GVRCompressedTexture.BALANCED, or GVRCompressedTexture.QUALITY, but other values are 'clamped' to one of the recognized values. Please note that this (currently) only applies to compressed textures; normal bitmapped textures don't take a quality parameter.

      • loadTexture

        public void loadTexture(GVRAndroidResource resource,
                        GVRAndroidResource.TextureCallback callback)
        Loads a texture asynchronously with default priority and quality. This method can detect whether the resource file holds a compressed texture (GVRF currently supports ASTC, ETC2, and KTX formats: applications can add new formats by implementing GVRCompressedTextureLoader): if the file is not a compressed texture, it is loaded as a normal, bitmapped texture. This format detection adds very little to the cost of loading even a compressed texture, and it makes your life a lot easier: you can replace, say, res/raw/resource.png with res/raw/resource.etc2 without having to change any code.
        Parameters:
        callback - Before loading, GVRF may call stillWanted() several times (on a background thread) to give you a chance to abort a 'stale' load. Successful loads will call loaded() on the GL thread; any errors will call failed(), with no promises about threading.

        This method uses a throttler to avoid overloading the system. If the throttler has threads available, it will run this request immediately. Otherwise, it will enqueue the request, and call stillWanted() at least once (on a background thread) to give you a chance to abort a 'stale' load.

        Use loadFutureTexture(GVRAndroidResource) to avoid having to implement a callback.

        resource - Basically, a stream containing a texture file. The GVRAndroidResource class has six constructors to handle a wide variety of Android resource types. Taking a GVRAndroidResource here eliminates six overloads.

      • loadModel

        public GVRModelSceneObject loadModel(java.lang.String filePath)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a scene object GVRModelSceneObject from a 3D model and adds it to the scene.
        Parameters:
        filePath - A filename, relative to the root of the volume. If the filename starts with "sd:" the file is assumed to reside on the SD Card. If the filename starts with "http:" or "https:" it is assumed to be a URL. Otherwise the file is assumed to be relative to the "assets" directory.
        Returns:
        A GVRModelSceneObject that contains the meshes with textures and bones and animations.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • loadModel

        public GVRModelSceneObject loadModel(java.lang.String filePath,
                                     GVRScene scene)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a scene object GVRModelSceneObject from a 3D model and adds it to the scene.
        Parameters:
        filePath - A filename, relative to the root of the volume. If the filename starts with "sd:" the file is assumed to reside on the SD Card. If the filename starts with "http:" or "https:" it is assumed to be a URL. Otherwise the file is assumed to be relative to the "assets" directory.
        scene - If present, this asset loader will wait until all of the textures have been loaded and then it will add the model to the scene.
        Returns:
        A GVRModelSceneObject that contains the meshes with textures and bones and animations.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • loadScene

        public GVRModelSceneObject loadScene(java.lang.String filePath,
                                     GVRScene scene)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a a 3D model and replaces the current scene with it.
        Parameters:
        filePath - A filename, relative to the root of the volume. If the filename starts with "sd:" the file is assumed to reside on the SD Card. If the filename starts with "http:" or "https:" it is assumed to be a URL. Otherwise the file is assumed to be relative to the "assets" directory.
        scene - Scene to be replaced with the model.
        Returns:
        A GVRModelSceneObject that contains the meshes with textures and bones and animations.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • loadScene

        public GVRSceneObject loadScene(GVRSceneObject model,
                                java.lang.String filePath,
                                GVRScene scene)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a a 3D model and replaces the current scene with it. The previous scene objects are removed and the loaded model becomes the only thing in the scene.
        Parameters:
        model - Scene object to become the root of the loaded model. This scene object will be named with the base filename of the loaded asset.
        filePath - A filename, relative to the root of the volume. If the filename starts with "sd:" the file is assumed to reside on the SD Card. If the filename starts with "http:" or "https:" it is assumed to be a URL. Otherwise the file is assumed to be relative to the "assets" directory.
        scene - Scene to be replaced with the model.
        Returns:
        A GVRModelSceneObject that contains the meshes with textures and bones and animations.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • loadModel

        public GVRSceneObject loadModel(GVRSceneObject model,
                                java.lang.String filePath,
                                GVRScene scene)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a scene object GVRSceneObject from a 3D model and adds it to the scene (if it is not already there).
        Parameters:
        model - A GVRSceneObject to become the root of the loaded model.
        filePath - Filename or URL of the asset to load. If the filename starts with "sd:" the file is assumed to reside on the SD Card. If the filename starts with "http:" or "https:" it is assumed to be a URL. Otherwise the file is assumed to be relative to the "assets" directory.
        scene - If present, this asset loader will wait until all of the textures have been loaded and then it will add the model to the scene.
        Returns:
        A GVRModelSceneObject that contains the meshes with textures and bones and animations.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • loadModel

        public GVRModelSceneObject loadModel(java.lang.String filePath,
                                     IAssetEvents handler)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a scene object GVRSceneObject from a 3D model and raises asset events to a handler.
        Parameters:
        filePath - A filename, relative to the root of the volume. If the filename starts with "sd:" the file is assumed to reside on the SD Card. If the filename starts with "http:" or "https:" it is assumed to be a URL. Otherwise the file is assumed to be relative to the "assets" directory.
        handler - IAssetEvents handler to process asset loading events
        Returns:
        A GVRModelSceneObject that contains the meshes with textures and bones and animations.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • loadModel

        public GVRModelSceneObject loadModel(java.lang.String filePath,
                                     java.util.EnumSet<GVRImportSettings> settings,
                                     boolean cacheEnabled,
                                     GVRScene scene)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a scene object GVRSceneObject from a 3D model and raises asset events to a handler.
        Parameters:
        filePath - A filename, relative to the root of the volume. If the filename starts with "sd:" the file is assumed to reside on the SD Card. If the filename starts with "http:" or "https:" it is assumed to be a URL. Otherwise the file is assumed to be relative to the "assets" directory.
        settings - Additional import settings
        cacheEnabled - If true, add the loaded model to the in-memory cache.
        scene - If present, this asset loader will wait until all of the textures have been loaded and then adds the model to the scene.
        Returns:
        A GVRModelSceneObject that contains the meshes with textures and bones and animations.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
